name: (C) Best HP Pt. FS (Other Fossil Furnace & AC)
_description: Best available air source heat pump w/ original distillate furnace backup

notes: COP = SEER / 3.412, COP = HSPF / 3.412 (see EIA source)
split system conversion factors SEER2/SEER = 0.95, HSPF2/HSPF = 0.85 (see RESNET source)

notes: Uses residential system costs and normalizes by typical capacity of residential systems (36 kBtu/h)

Retail (new) and total installed (existing) for 'High' ASHPs in 2023. For existing buildings, additional tank removal costs of 800 2014$ (975 2022$) are applied for distillate and propane based on the 2015 EIA report, updating the cost from April 2014 to April 2022. No additional electrical infrastructure costs assumed for dual fuel residential measures.

source_data.title: Updated Buildings Sector Appliance and Equipment Costs and Efficiencies

source_data.title: Service Upgrades for Electrification Retrofits Study Final Report

source_data.title: Updated Buildings Sector Appliance and Equipment Costs and Efficiencies
source_data.author: U.S. Energy Information Administration

notes: Heating multiple of 21% was determined by dividing square feet in which main heating equipment is oil or propane furnace (961852 sf) by square feet in switch main heating equipment is oil or propane furnace or packaged unit (4543002 sf)

cooling multiple of 37% was determined by dividing square feet in which cooling equipment is residential split system or individual AC unit AND heating equipment is not natural gas or electric (13428155 sf) by square feet with same cooling constraint and heating across all fossil fuel types (36556957 sf). Ventilation multiples determined by square feet in which given ventilation system (VAV or CAV) is paired with given heating system for the measure.
